comments:
I run Eclipse buildId=M20060629-1905 with the arguments shown below.
I run Mandriva Linux 64-bit on a AMD64 processor but I use the 32-bit JDK from SUN (see below).

THE PROBLEM: it is not possible to run a program with run (running ant does not work either), a window appears to tell me "exception occurred executing command line.". There is a details button but it is grayed out.

Output from the log is given below together with an extract from the top program showing that all the ram is actually used, but there is still some swap free. 

---
eclipse.buildId=M20060629-1905
java.version=1.5.0_08
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  -vm /usr/java/jdk-32bit/bin/java
Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86 -vm /usr/java/jdk-32bit/bin/java

----
!ENTRY org.eclipse.debug.core 4 120 2006-09-21 06:45:46.013
!MESSAGE Exception occurred executing command line.
!STACK 0
java.io.IOException: java.io.IOException: Cannot allocate memory
        at java.lang.UNIXProcess.<init>(UNIXProcess.java:148)
        at java.lang.ProcessImpl.start(ProcessImpl.java:65)
        at java.lang.ProcessBuilder.start(ProcessBuilder.java:451)
        at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:591)
        at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin.exec(DebugPlugin.java:744)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.AbstractVMRunner.exec(AbstractVMRunner.java:70)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMRunner.run(StandardVMRunner.java:241)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaLaunchDelegate.launch(JavaLaunchDelegate.java:101)
        at org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.AntLaunchDelegate.runInSeparateVM(AntLaunchDelegate.java:550)
        at org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.AntLaunchDelegate.launch(AntLaunchDelegate.java:209)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:639)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:565)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:754)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:944)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

----
top - 20:03:10 up 23 days, 21:06,  1 user,  load average: 1.10, 1.20, 1.11
Tasks: 164 total,   2 running, 162 sleeping,   0 stopped,   0 zombie
Cpu(s): 11.7% us,  2.3% sy,  0.0% ni, 86.0% id,  0.0% wa,  0.0% hi,  0.0% si
Mem:   2059944k total,  2042168k used,    17776k free,    33576k buffers
Swap:  1630556k total,  1456232k used,   174324k free,   271068k cached

If you try using a 64-bit VM does the problem still occur?

I am not sure there is much (if anything) we can do about this, we delegate the commandline (from the run dialog) to java.lang.Runtime and let it handle the process creation, etc.

Taking a quick loook at sun's developer forums there are a lot of memory related problems using a 32-bit vm with a 64-bit processor.
There is nothing we can do about this bug, this is a vm/processor problem. Closing as INVALID
